metadata.title: visionOS Widget Styles - Consolidated Reference
metadata.author: Apple Inc.
metadata.summary: Comprehensive documentation of visionOS widget styling APIs including mounting styles (elevated, recessed), visual textures (glass, paper), and level of detail options (default, simplified). These APIs are available starting visionOS 26.0+ and enable developers to customize widget appearance and behavior in spatial computing environments.

widgetMountingStyle.description: Defines how a widget is visually mounted or positioned in the visionOS environment. Controls the spatial relationship between the widget and its surrounding context.

configurationMethod.name: supportedMountingStyles(_:)
configurationMethod.description: Specifies which mounting styles the widget supports. Apply this modifier to declare the visual mounting options available for your widget.

styles.name: elevated
styles.description: Mounting style surrounding the widget with a composite material

visualCharacteristics.appearance: Widget appears raised from its background surface
visualCharacteristics.spatialPresence: Creates visual depth by elevating the widget above its mounting surface
visualCharacteristics.lightInteraction: Material may catch and reflect ambient lighting

useCases: Widgets that need visual prominence
Content that should stand out from the background
Interactive widgets where depth perception aids usability
Floating or modal-style widget presentations

styles.name: recessed
styles.description: Mounting style where a widget is displayed within a recessed portal

visualCharacteristics.appearance: Widget appears embedded or inset into its background surface
visualCharacteristics.spatialPresence: Creates depth by appearing to sit within the mounting surface
visualCharacteristics.lightInteraction: May create subtle shadow effects around the widget edges

useCases: Widgets that should feel integrated with the environment
Content that displays through a window-like opening
Subtle, non-intrusive widget presentations
Dashboard-style layouts where widgets appear as inset panels

widgetTexture.description: Defines the visual surface treatment applied to the widget's coating layer. Controls how the widget surface appears and interacts with light in the visionOS environment.

configurationMethod.name: widgetTexture(_:)
configurationMethod.description: Applies a texture to the widget's coating layer to define its visual surface properties.

textures.name: glass
textures.description: A reflective, clear glass-like texture for the widget's coating layer

visualCharacteristics.lightInteraction: Reflects light and may show environmental reflections
visualCharacteristics.transparency: Clear transparency allowing content visibility through material

useCases: Modern, sleek widget designs
Widgets that should feel premium and polished
Content that benefits from depth and layering effects
Spatial UI elements that integrate with visionOS glass aesthetic
Widgets requiring environmental awareness through reflections
designConsiderations: Consider content contrast against reflective surface
Works well with visionOS spatial design language
May require careful color choices for readability
Pairs well with the elevated mounting style for maximum depth

textures.name: paper
textures.description: A matte, paper-like texture for the widget's coating layer

visualCharacteristics.lightInteraction: Diffuses light rather than reflecting it

useCases: Content-focused widgets where readability is priority
Note-taking or document-style widgets
Widgets displaying text-heavy content
Designs requiring reduced visual distraction
Widgets that should feel physical and tangible
designConsiderations: May feel more traditional compared to glass

levelOfDetail.description: Indicates the appropriate level of content complexity and detail a widget should display. On visionOS, this typically relates to user distance from the widget.

levels.name: default
levels.behavior: This suggests the app should lay out its content and show a default amount of information

visualCharacteristics.layoutComplexity: Normal layout with all expected elements

useCases: Standard widget viewing distance
Primary widget presentation
Normal user interaction scenarios
When full widget information is appropriate

visionOSContext.spatialConsideration: User is close enough to see detailed content

levels.name: simplified
levels.description: The level of detail should be simplified
levels.behavior: This suggests the app should lay out its content and show a simplified version of its content. On visionOS specifically, this signals that the user is at a further distance.
useCases: User is viewing from a distance (visionOS)
Reduced-detail presentation
Glanceable information display
When only key information should be visible

visionOSContext.spatialConsideration: User is too far to comfortably read detailed content
visionOSContext.adaptiveGuidance: Hide secondary information, enlarge primary content, simplify layouts

recommendations.when: Widget content should appear prominent and floating
recommendations.avoidWhen: Widget should feel integrated or subtle

recommendations.when: Widget should feel embedded in the environment
recommendations.avoidWhen: Widget needs to draw attention or appear interactive

recommendations.when: Widget should feel modern, premium, and spatially aware
recommendations.avoidWhen: High text readability is critical, or reflections would distract

recommendations.when: Content readability is priority, or widget should feel physical
recommendations.avoidWhen: Widget should feel modern or spatially integrated with visionOS

recommendations.layoutStrategy: Display full widget content with normal information density
Show only essential information, increase font sizes, remove secondary details
recommendations.visionOSNote: On visionOS, this indicates the user has moved further from the widget

combinations.effect: Premium floating panel with reflective surface
combinations.bestFor: Hero widgets, media players, interactive controls

keyTerms.definition: A struct defining how widgets are visually positioned relative to their background in visionOS
A struct defining the surface treatment applied to a widget's coating layer
A struct indicating the appropriate content complexity based on viewing context, particularly user distance in visionOS
A mounting style that surrounds the widget with composite material, creating a floating appearance
A mounting style where the widget appears within a recessed portal, creating an inset appearance
A reflective, clear glass-like texture for the widget's coating layer
A matte, paper-like texture for the widget's coating layer
The surface layer of a widget that textures are applied to

keyFindings: visionOS widget styles are available starting iOS/iPadOS/visionOS 26.0+
Two mounting styles exist: elevated (floating) and recessed (inset portal)
Two textures exist: glass (reflective, clear) and paper (matte)
Level of detail can be default or simplified, with simplified indicating far user distance on visionOS
All style APIs are part of the WidgetKit framework
Textures specifically mention the 'coating layer' suggesting a layered material system
The simplified level of detail explicitly addresses spatial computing distance considerations
designPatterns: Use elevated + glass for premium, modern widget experiences
Use recessed + paper for content-focused, readable widgets
Implement level of detail switching for distance-aware content adaptation
Consider user distance as a key factor in visionOS widget design
